title: The Ultimate Guide to Getting the Shark Anchor in Blox Fruits

steps.title: Purchase a Monster Magnet from the Shark Hunter.
steps.content: Purchase a Monster Magnet from the Shark Hunter. Find the Shark Hunter NPC in the Third Sea area, and purchase a Monster Magnet from them. You’ll need the following items to unlock it: [1] X Research source 2 Terror Eyes 8 Electric Wings 10 Shark Teeth 20 Fool’s Gold Tip: Some players recommend purchasing the other items that the Shark Hunter offers, like the Terror Jaw and Shark Tooth Necklace. These items offer buffs that may help with your battle.

steps.title: Join a party and equip your Monster Magnet.
steps.content: Join a party and equip your Monster Magnet. As a Raid Boss, the Anchor Terrorshark is very difficult to beat on your own. Join up with some friends or fellow players to help take down this boss, since it’ll have 195,000 health. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Find a Terrorshark between Sea Danger Levels 2 through 6.
steps.content: Find a Terrorshark between Sea Danger Levels 2 through 6. Once your Monster Magnet attracts an Anchor Terrorshark, you’ll see the “Your <Monster Magnet> has attracted an irregular beast…” prompt on your screen. You’ll need to venture fairly deep into the sea to attract this creature.

steps.title: Defeat the Terrorshark to receive a Shark Anchor.
steps.content: Defeat the Terrorshark to receive a Shark Anchor. Work with your teammates to take down the Anchor Terrorshark—you can track your damage via the large bar at the top of the screen. Once you defeat the creature (assuming your Monster Magnet was used), you’ll receive a Shark Anchor at the end of battle.

steps.title: Your Monster Magnet must be used to get the Shark Anchor.
steps.content: Your Monster Magnet must be used to get the Shark Anchor. If another player’s Monster Magnet is consumed to summon the Terrorshark, only they will get the Shark Anchor drop. [3] X Research source

steps.title: You have to deal at least 10% of the total damage to get the weapon.
steps.content: You have to deal at least 10% of the total damage to get the weapon. If you don’t do enough damage in battle, you won’t get the drop. [4] X Research source

steps.title: The Anchor Terrorshark has to have 195,000 health.
steps.content: The Anchor Terrorshark has to have 195,000 health. If a weaker Terrorshark spawns (with 150,000 health), you won’t get the Shark Anchor drop.

steps.title: Typhoon Toss
steps.content: Typhoon Toss This causes you to swing and spin your weapon around quickly and send out shark attacks, which create waterspouts when they hit things. To make the Typhoon Toss even bigger, charge it up ahead of time. [5] X Research source Keybind: Z

steps.title: Armor Breaker
steps.content: Armor Breaker A special attack that combines a dash, uppercut, and slam-down. The larger the target, the more damage the attack does. [6] X Research source Keybind: X
